Summary: August natural gas futures were on track to decline for a sixth straight session through midday trading Tuesday, undercut by cooler weather forecasts and weaker cash prices. Natural gas futures flipped negative through midday trading Tuesday after weather forecasts shaved off some of the Lower 48's blistering heat expected over the next two weeks. August natural gas futures fell below key support through midday trading Monday as weather forecasts trimmed demand outlooks and Lower 48 gas output rose to a new three-month high.

Title: Natural Gas Futures Drift Lower After Light EIA Storage Print; Cash Weaker — MidDay Market Snapshot - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: August natural gas futures were on track for their seventh straight loss through midday trading Wednesday after the latest in-line weekly storage injection was accompanied by a bearish revision to the previous week. The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) reported a seasonally light build of 32 Bcf for the week ending June 28, causing natural gas futures to drop 2.2 cents to $2.413/MMBtu.

Title: August Natural Gas Futures Dragged Below $2.500 Amid Higher Production, Milder Weather Forecasts — MidDay ... - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: August natural gas futures fell below key support through midday trading Monday as weather forecasts trimmed demand outlooks and Lower 48 gas output rose to a new three-month high. August Nymex natural gas futures were down 12.3 cents to $2.478/MMBtu, with Lower 48 gas production rising to 102 Bcf/d, the highest level since March 11. Category 4 Hurricane Beryl was tracking to cross Mexico's Yucatan Peninsula, potentially avoiding a direct strike on the Lower 48.

Title: Rystad Energy: Bullish market fundamentals are the main contributing factor to higher global oil prices - World Pipelines
Summary: Strong market fundamentals, such as lower crude exports from OPEC and Russia and increased refinery runs for the summer peak, are pushing oil prices higher. Rystad Energy's modeling suggests most price increases are driven by refining and crude fundamentals, while macroeconomic factors and geopolitical risks play a secondary role. Brent prices increased by more than 6% in June, and July is starting similarly. US oil production forecasts have been lowered from August onwards due to a downturn in Permian oil output, which is bullish for Brent prices.

Title: Offshore Drilling Market Size Set to Surge, Forecasted to Reach USD 89.61 Billion by 2032 - openPR
Summary: The offshore drilling market is projected to reach USD 89.61 billion by 2032, indicating significant growth potential. This presents opportunities for ADNOC Global Trading to expand its offshore drilling operations and capitalize on the increasing market demand.

Title: Natural Gas Futures Extend Losses as Forecasts Suggest Demand Risks While Production Rises - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: Natural gas futures have extended losses due to higher production and lower demand outlooks, driven by softened weather forecasts and storm fears. ADNOC Global Trading should monitor these trends as they could impact natural gas pricing and trading strategies.

Title: US natural gas prices ease - Markets - Business Recorder
Summary: US natural gas prices have decreased by about 1% due to rising output and lower demand forecasts. Additionally, LNG feedgas demand is lower, and an oversupply of gas in storage persists. This situation could affect ADNOC Global Trading's natural gas trading and export strategies.

Title: [Updated] Drilling Engineering and Technical Services Market Size Analysis | Jereh Oilfield Services Group, ZPEC ... - economica.ma
Summary: The report provides a comprehensive analysis of the Drilling Engineering and Technical Services market from 2024 to 2031, including pricing, geographical regions, technology, and supply-demand dynamics. Title: Selling Continues for Natural Gas Futures; California Cash Down Sharply Despite Heat — MidDay Market Snapshot - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: Natural gas futures experienced a decline for the sixth consecutive session due to cooler weather forecasts and weaker cash prices. Despite ongoing heat in California, August natural gas futures fell by 3.9 cents to $2.439/MMBtu. A federal court ruling to lift the LNG permit pause by the U.S. Department of Energy provided some support to the back of the curve. The report highlights the volatility in natural gas futures influenced by weather changes and regulatory actions.

Title: US natural gas prices fall - Markets - Business Recorder
Summary: U.S. natural gas futures fell about 3% to a one-month low due to rising output, reduced demand forecasts, and oversupply in storage. Despite a heatwave increasing gas consumption for air conditioning, front-month gas futures for August delivery dropped by 2.5%. Speculators also reduced their net long positions for the first time in three weeks. The Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) indicated a potential record-breaking demand due to high temperatures, although previous records were not surpassed.

Title: Asia's first half crude oil imports slip, undermining bullish forecasts - Reuters
Summary: Asia's crude oil imports in the first half of the year have declined, challenging previously optimistic market forecasts. This development may impact global oil demand projections and trading strategies for ADNOC Global Trading.

Title: August Natural Gas Futures Dragged Below $2.500 Amid Higher Production, Milder Weather Forecasts — MidDay ... - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: August natural gas futures fell below $2.500/MMBtu amid increased production and milder weather forecasts, affecting market prices and potentially influencing trading decisions. Lower 48 gas production reached a three-month high, while weather forecasts reduced demand outlooks.

Title: Rystad Energy: Bullish market fundamentals are the main contributing factor to higher global oil prices - World Pipelines
Summary: Strong market fundamentals, including lower crude exports from OPEC and Russia and rising refinery runs, are driving higher global oil prices. Expectations of interest rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve and high geopolitical risks also contribute to the bullish trend. These factors are essential for ADNOC Global Trading to consider in their market strategies.

Title: Natural Gas Futures Drift Lower After Light EIA Storage Print; Cash Weaker — MidDay Market Snapshot - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: August natural gas futures continued their decline for the seventh straight session due to a modest weekly storage build and a bearish revision to the previous week. The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) reported a seasonally light build of 32 Bcf for the week ending June 28, which contributed to the bearish sentiment. This ongoing trend indicates a potential oversupply in the market, which is crucial for ADNOC Global Trading to monitor as it affects pricing and demand dynamics.

Title: US natural gas prices fall - Markets - Business Recorder
Summary: US natural gas futures remained near a seven-week low as the market awaited a federal report expected to show a smaller-than-usual storage build for the eighth consecutive week. Despite a bullish heat wave prompting high gas usage for electricity, higher output and substantial oversupply in storage weighed on prices. This situation reflects significant market volatility and supply-demand imbalances, which are critical for ADNOC Global Trading to consider for strategic planning and risk management.

Title: Asia's first half crude oil imports slip, undermining bullish forecasts - Reuters
Summary: Asia's crude oil imports have declined in the first half of the year, which contradicts earlier optimistic market forecasts. This trend could impact global oil prices and trading strategies, particularly for markets heavily reliant on Asian demand.

Title: August Natural Gas Futures Dragged Below $2.500 Amid Higher Production, Milder Weather Forecasts — MidDay ... - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: August natural gas futures fell below $2.500/MMBtu due to increased production and milder weather forecasts that reduced demand outlooks. This information is crucial for trading strategies as it highlights potential bearish market conditions.

Title: Natural Gas Futures Extend Losses as Forecasts Suggest Demand Risks While Production Rises - Natural Gas Intelligence
Summary: Natural gas futures continue to experience losses driven by higher production levels and lower demand outlooks amid softened weather forecasts and storm concerns. This situation indicates a volatile market environment, necessitating cautious trading approaches.
